incidents.headline: Hall Boulevard is closed where it passes over OR 217 in Tigard, at Pfaffle Street. Use Greenburg Road as a detour route.
incidents.comments:
The Hall Boulevard overpass over OR 217 near OR 99W and Pfaffle Street in Tigard is closed for nine months, starting in March 2024. The intersection of Pfaffle Street and Hall Boulevard is also closed. Drivers are not permitted to turn onto Hall Boulevard from Pfaffle Street or turn onto Pfaffle Street from Hall Boulevard. All vehicle traffic should use the signed detour using Greenburg Road. People walking and bicycling will still be able to cross OR 217 via a temporary pedestrian bridge.
<!--Links Start Here-->
[Link to Additional Information](https://www.oregon.gov/odot/OR217/Pages/default.aspx)

incidents.headline: Nighttime single lane closures on OR 217 in both directions weekdays.
incidents.comments:
Daytime closure of the auxiliary lane on northbound OR 217 between 72nd Avenue and OR 99W 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. weekdays. Nighttime lane closures on the Denney Road overpass Monday through Wednesday. Sidewalk closure on the south side of Hall Boulevard between Scholls Ferry Road and Cascade Avenue. Ongoing closures: Hall Boulevard over OR 217 in Tigard is closed until early 2025 to replace the bridge. Periodic lane closures on Hall Boulevard between Scholls Ferry Road and Cascade Avenue. One lane in each direction is closed around-the-clock on the Scholls Ferry Road overpass for several months. Auxiliary lane closures on OR 217 south from Scholls Ferry Road to OR 99W and on OR 217 north from Scholls Ferry Road to Denney Road. Expect shoulder closures on OR 217, various on- and off-ramps, and on local roads near the highway ramps. Various on- and off-ramps temporarily narrowed. Pedestrian detours on the Hall Boulevard overpass in Beaverton.
<!--Links Start Here-->
[Link to Additional Information](https://www.oregon

incidents.headline: A section of the Historic Columbia River Highway/U.S. 30 between Wahkeena Falls and Multnomah Falls is closed to all users until Memorial Day 2025.
incidents.comments:
Use I-84 Exit 31 or take transit to visit Multnomah Falls. There is no vehicle or bicycle access to Multnomah Falls heading eastbound on the Historic Highway. The Wahkeena-Multnomah Falls return trail #442 is open to hikers.
<!--Links Start Here-->
[Link to Additional Information](https://www.oregon.gov/odot/Regions/Pages/ColumbiaGorgeProjects.aspx)

files.file-description: October 2024 to Memorial Day 2025: There is no access to Multnomah Falls by heading eastbound on the Historic Highway. incidents.headline: Road construction is occurring. Use an alternate route.
incidents.comments:
Foots Creek bridge is CLOSED the week of October 21, 2024 for approximately 5 days. Find an alternate route. This project will replace three 1920s-era bridges on Rogue River Highway with structures that are better able to withstand earthquakes. The bridges are located east of the city of Rogue River at Birdseye Creek (MP 10.8), Foots Creek (MP 11.4), and Millers Gulch (MP 12.2).
<!--Links Start Here-->
[For More Information (Click for Link to Project)](https://www.oregon.gov/odot/projects/pages/project-details.aspx?project=22290)

incidents.headline: Nighttime lane and ramp closures.
incidents.comments: Nighttime closures of the I-205 north ramp to OR 99E (exit 9) and the OR 99E on-ramp to I-205 north 10 p.m. to 5 a.m. Wednesday through Friday, until 7 a.m. Saturday. If weather allows, nighttime closures of the I-205 north ramp to OR 43 (exit 8) and the OR 43 on-ramp to I-205 north 10 p.m. to 5 a.m. Monday and Tuesday. Nighttime lane closures on I-205 Wednesday through Friday nights and on OR 43 in both directions and on Willamette Falls Drive 8 p.m. to 6 a.m. Monday and Tuesday.  Single lane closures on Clackamette Drive, Willamette Falls Drive. Auxiliary lane closure on OR 99E north. Pedestrian detours on OR 43 and OR 99E.

incidents.headline: Road construction is occurring. Prepare to slow. Watch for workers.
incidents.comments: Bridge work on USBR Bridge at MP 273.71, Link River Bridge at MP 275.03, and the Green Spring Bridge at MP 277.12. Link River Bridge at MP 275.03: Lane shift traffic control installed on Main Street, bridge work will be done behind the barrier, no delays expected. incidents.headline: Lane closures on OR 35 with traffic directed by a temporary signal. Shoulder closures weekdays on U.S. 26.
incidents.comments:
Project Description: This project will resurface the bridge deck on the Oregon Highway 35 overpass at U.S. 26 (Mt. Hood Highway) interchange in Mt. Hood, east of Government Camp. Making these repairs now increases the service life of the road and provides a smoother, safer ride for travelers.
